item.title: TraitTrainR published in Bioinformatics Advances!
item.description:
Jenny’s paper has been published in Bioinformatics Advances, detailing the computational advances and applications of TraitTrainR for understanding continuous trait evolution.

Congrats Jenny!

Check out the github here: https://github.com/radamsRHA/TraitTrainR

And the study itself: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformaticsadvances/article/5/1/vbae196/7919597

item.title: Adams Analytics Group rocks ESA 2024!
item.description:
Jenniffer Roa Lozano (MS; Statistics & Analytics) and Mataya Duncan (MS; CEMB) both gave fantastic presentations at the annual Entomology Society Conference in Pheonix AZ.

Mataya also won a student presentation award!!!

Great work, Mataya and Jenny!

More to come! [ADD HERE]

item.title: Robust algorithms for phylogenetic regression published!
item.description:
Check out our recent paper that introduces new Robust phylogenetic algorithms for comparative biology.

Check it out!

https://academic.oup.com/sysbio/article/73/1/140/7456117

item.title: Red milkweed beetle genome is published!!
item.description:
Red Milkweed beetles and their milkweed hosts are a poster child of codiversification at the insect-plant interface.

We recently sequenced and assembled a reference genome for the common red milkweed longhorn beetle (Tetraopes tetraopthalmus). Check it out!

Check it out!

https://academic.oup.com/jhered/advance-article/doi/10.1093/jhered/esae049/7745656

Also check out the media posts : )

2024: Adams et al. 2024 (New Beetle genome) Media Coverage: https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/technology/red-milkweed-beetle-genome-offers-evolutionary-insights-into-plant-insect-interactions/ar-AA1s2TUR?ocid=BingNewsSerp https://phys.org/news/2024-10-red-milkweed-beetle-genome-evolutionary.html https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2024/10/241010142548.htm https://www.earth.com/news/how-does-the-milkweed-beetle-safely-feed-on-a-toxic-plant/ https://newtoncountytimes.com/stories/red-milkweed-beetle-genome-offers-insight-into-plant-insect-interactions,153622 https://headtopics.com/us/red-milkweed-beetle-genome-offers-insight-into-plant-insect-60271628 https://www.lifetechnology.com/blogs/life-technology-science-news/red-milkweed-beetle-genome-offers-evolutionary-insights-into-plant-insect-interactions https://www.miragenews.com/red-milkweed-beetle-genome-reveals-plant-insect-1334794/ https://bioquicknews.com/red-milkweed-beetle-genome-offers-insight-into-plant-insect-interactions/ http://www.mafg.net/NewsDetail.aspx?NewsID=12143 https://www.newsbreak.com/news/3628868175193-red-milkweed-beetle-genome-offers-insight-into-plant-insect-interactions https://www.magnoliareporter.com/education/colleges_universities/article_85481c70-8aca-11ef-a674-1f30224bf730.html

item.title: New paper published in Molecular Biology and Evolution
item.description:
Check out our recent paper that introduces new, likelihood-based hypothesis tests for phylogenomics, which was recently published in Molecular Biology and Evolution!

Check out our recent paper that introduces new, likelihood-based hypothesis tests for phylogenomics, which was recently published in Molecular Biology and Evolution!

We can always estimate a phylogeny, but how much do you believe in your tree?

Here we describe new statistical frameworks for explicitly testing hypotheses about species-level relationships using gene trees.

Check it out!

https://academic.oup.com/mbe/article/40/7/msad159/7223883

item.title: New collaborative paper published in Genome Biology and Evolution
item.description:
Check out our recent collaborative work on single-cell RNAseq published in Genome Biology and Evolution!

Check out our recent collaborative work on single-cell RNAseq published in Genome Biology and Evolution!

https://academic.oup.com/gbe/article/15/6/evad109/7197270

Here we leverage single-cell RNAseq to understand regulatory variation underlying an extreme phenotype (venom!)

item.title: Wooo Pig Sooie!
item.description:
We have some exciting news: the Adams Analytics Group as moved to the University of Arkansas Division of Agriculture! We are currently establishing our lab in the Department of Entomology and Plant Pathology, and the Center for Agricultural Data Analytics.

We are actively recruiting graduate and undergraduate students interested in machine learning, genomics, statistics, and evolution. Email Dr. Adams (adamsrh@uark.edu) if you are interested!

Exciting things ahead!

item.title: Collaborative work published in Nature Ecology and Evolution
item.description:
We are very excited to share our new publication in Nature Ecology & Evolution!

Detecting balancing selection is notoriously challenging, and we applied machine learning approaches to better detect such patterns from population genomic data.

item.title: NSF-ROA funded!
item.description:
We have some exciting news: our collaborative NSF-ROA proposal “Leveraging genomes, transcriptomes, and proteomes alongside student training to improve genome annotation” has been accepted for funding!

This proposal represents a collaborative effort with the McKenna lab at the University of Memphis to improve annotation of difficult-to-find genes (e.g., olfactory receptor) in longhorned beetles. Rich will be a visiting scientist at UofM in Summer 2022, and this proposal will fund undergraduate researchers to work on the problem of “fantastic genes and where to find them”.

Exciting things ahead!

item.title: MURACE funded!
item.description:
We have some exciting news: Zoe Cain’s MURACE proposal was funded for Summer 2022!

Zoe will be working this Summer on data science projects, and the application of supervised learning algorithms to gene expression data. Great work, Zoe!

item.title: Collaborative work published in PNAS
item.description:
We are very excited to share our new publication in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, which illuminated molecular evolution of beetles along the Antartic Polar Front.

Exciting things ahead!

item.title: Of Traits & Trees published in SysBio
item.description: Check our recently published study in Systematic Biology that provides new mathematical tools and software for studying “Big Data” in evolutionary biology.
